titleStmt.title: A pleasant dialogue betwixt two vvanton ladies of pleasure; or, The Dutchess of Porsmouths woful farwel to her former felicity. One lady she couragiously stands in her own defence; the other now doth seem to b[ow,] her colours are display'd, assuredly none can deny, the words she speaks is sence: she is content, her mind is but, still to maintain her trade. Tune of, Tan tarra rara, tan tivee.

publicationStmt.publisher: printed for J. Deacon in Guiltspur-street.,

notesStmt.note: Place and date of publication suggested by Wing; in ms. following title: 17. Feb. 1684/5.
Verse: "BRave Gallants now listen and I will you tell ..."
Imperfect: faded and torn at foot with loss of text.
Reproduction of original in the British Library.
